title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: Elizabeth Bennet, a witty and independent young woman, navigates the complex social hierarchies of Regency England. When she meets the proud and aloof Mr. Darcy, their initial mutual disdain slowly transforms into a deep understanding and love. Through misunderstandings, family scandals, and societal pressure, both characters must overcome their own prejudices and pride to find happiness. It is a sharp, humorous, and timeless exploration of class, marriage, and personal growth.
themes: love, society, class, pride, prejudice, growth
mood_tags: witty, romantic, uplifting, charming, satirical, clever

author: George Orwell
summary: Winston Smith lives in a dystopian future where the totalitarian Party, led by the omnipresent Big Brother, controls every aspect of life, including thought and history. Working at the Ministry of Truth, Winston begins to secretly rebel against the regime, falling in love with Julia and seeking the truth about the past. However, in a world where surveillance is absolute and dissent is crushed through psychological torture, his quest for freedom leads to a devastating and haunting conclusion about the nature of power and the human spirit.
themes: freedom, control, truth, propaganda, surveillance, despair
mood_tags: dark, oppressive, tense, chilling, bleak, thought-provoking

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: Nick Carraway moves to New York and becomes neighbors with the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby, who throws lavish parties every weekend in hopes of attracting his lost love, Daisy Buchanan. As Nick gets drawn into Gatsby's world of wealth and illusion, he witnesses the tragic consequences of obsession and the hollowness of the American Dream. Set against the backdrop of the Roaring Twenties, this is a lyrical and melancholic tale of love, loss, and the impossibility of recapturing the past.
themes: wealth, love, illusion, dreams, decay, nostalgia
mood_tags: melancholic, longing, critical, lush, tragic, atmospheric

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: Young Scout Finch grows up in the racist South during the Great Depression, watching her father, Atticus, defend a black man falsely accused of raping a white woman. Through the trial and the mysteries of their reclusive neighbor Boo Radley, Scout learns profound lessons about justice, empathy, and the coexistence of good and evil. It is a heartwarming yet serious story about moral courage and the loss of innocence in a flawed world.
themes: justice, racism, innocence, morality, empathy, childhood
mood_tags: thought-provoking, serious, hopeful, heartfelt, moral, moving

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins, a comfort-loving hobbit, is swept out of his quiet home by the wizard Gandalf and a company of dwarves on a quest to reclaim their mountain kingdom from the dragon Smaug. Along the way, Bilbo discovers courage he never knew he had, finds a mysterious ring, and faces trolls, goblins, and giant spiders. It is a whimsical, adventurous, and cozy fairy tale that bridges the gap between a child's story and an epic myth.
themes: adventure, courage, home, greed, friendship, destiny
mood_tags: cozy, adventurous, whimsical, exciting, warm, heroic

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
summary: Paul Atreides, a brilliant young nobleman, is thrust into the dangerous desert planet Arrakis, the only source of the universe's most valuable substance: spice. As his family is destroyed by political intrigue, Paul must survive the harsh environment, ally with the native Fremen, and embrace a terrifying destiny that could change the course of humanity. This is an epic, complex saga of religion, ecology, politics, and survival on a grand scale.
themes: power, religion, survival, ecology, politics, destiny
mood_tags: epic, intense, complex, philosophical, grand, immersive

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd, dreams of finding a worldly treasure buried near the Egyptian pyramids. Guided by a series of omens and encounters with a king, an alchemist, and the wind itself, he journeys across Africa. Along the way, he learns that the true treasure is the journey itself and the realization of one's 'Personal Legend.' It is a simple, spiritual, and inspiring fable about listening to your heart and following your dreams.
themes: purpose, destiny, journey, spirituality, dreams, simplicity
mood_tags: inspiring, spiritual, calm, hopeful, reflective, magical

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
summary: On their fifth wedding anniversary, Nick Dunne's wife Amy disappears, and all evidence points to him as the murderer. As the media circus intensifies, Nick struggles to prove his innocence while hiding dark secrets about their marriage. But the truth is far more twisted than anyone imagines, involving a elaborate game of manipulation and revenge. This is a shocking, tense, and cynical thriller that dissects the facade of a perfect marriage.
themes: marriage, secrets, media, manipulation, revenge, identity
mood_tags: tense, shocking, dark, suspenseful, cynical, twisty

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
summary: In the perfectly planned suburb of Shaker Heights, the orderly life of the Richardson family is upended by the arrival of Mia Warren, an enigmatic artist and her daughter. As secrets from the past unravel and a custody battle divides the community, the differences between the two mothers ignite a series of 'little fires' that expose the hypocrisies of suburban life. It is a dramatic and emotional exploration of motherhood, class, and the weight of secrets.
themes: family, secrets, perfection, motherhood, class, identity
mood_tags: tense, dramatic, emotional, intriguing, critical, layered

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
summary: Nora Seed, filled with regret and suicidal thoughts, finds herself in a library between life and death. Each book on the shelves offers a chance to live a different version of her life based on the choices she didn't make. From being a rock star to an Olympic swimmer, Nora explores infinite possibilities to find what makes life worth living. It is a comforting, philosophical, and deeply hopeful story about regret, choice, and the beauty of the imperfect life we actually have.
themes: regret, choices, life, depression, hope, second chances
mood_tags: hopeful, reflective, comforting, philosophical, uplifting, emotional

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
summary: Ryland Grace wakes up alone on a spaceship with amnesia. As his memory returns, he realizes he is humanity's last hope on a desperate mission to save Earth from a cosmic disaster. Stranded light-years from home with two dead crewmates, he must use his scientific knowledge to survive. The story becomes a brilliant and heartwarming tale of problem-solving, friendship with an unexpected alien companion, and the power of collaboration against impossible odds. It's funny, tense, and deeply optimistic.
themes: friendship, sacrifice, science, exploration, survival, cooperation
mood_tags: suspenseful, funny, hopeful, heartwarming, thrilling, optimistic, clever, nerdy

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
summary: Kya Clark, known as the 'Marsh Girl,' grows up isolated in the dangerous marshes of North Carolina after being abandoned by her family. She learns to survive alone in nature until she befriends two young men, but when one is found dead, she becomes the prime suspect. This is a lyrical, atmospheric mystery that blends a coming-of-age story with a murder trial, celebrating the resilience of the human spirit and the healing power of nature.
themes: nature, isolation, survival, prejudice, love, mystery
mood_tags: melancholic, mysterious, atmospheric, lyrical, lonely, poignant

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
summary: This practical guide reveals how tiny changes in behavior can lead to remarkable results over time. James Clear breaks down the science of habit formation, offering proven strategies to build good habits, break bad ones, and master the tiny behaviors that lead to success. It is not just about motivation, but about designing a system for continuous improvement. Empowering and actionable, it transforms the way you think about progress and human potential.
themes: self-improvement, habits, success, psychology, systems, growth
mood_tags: practical, motivating, clear, empowering, logical, actionable

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
summary: Yuval Noah Harari takes readers on a breathtaking journey through the entire history of humankind, from the Stone Age to the present. He explores how Homo sapiens came to dominate the planet through cognitive, agricultural, and scientific revolutions. By examining the role of fiction, money, empires, and religion, Harari challenges our understanding of what it means to be human. It is a thought-provoking, educational, and broad overview that changes how you see the world.
themes: history, humanity, evolution, society, culture, future
mood_tags: thought-provoking, educational, broad, analytical, enlightening, objective

title: The Body Keeps the Score
author: Bessel van der Kolk
summary: Pioneering trauma researcher Bessel van der Kolk explores how trauma reshapes both the body and the brain, compromising sufferers' capacities for pleasure, engagement, self-control, and trust. He examines innovative treatments ranging from medication and talk therapy to yoga and EMDR, offering a path to recovery. This is a heavy but ultimately healing and compassionate book that validates the experiences of survivors and offers hope for restoration.
themes: trauma, healing, psychology, neuroscience, recovery, resilience
mood_tags: heavy, informative, healing, compassionate, serious, validating

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
summary: Born to survivalist parents in the mountains of Idaho, Tara Westover never attended school or saw a doctor until she was seventeen. Driven by a thirst for knowledge, she teaches herself enough to gain admission to college, eventually earning a PhD from Cambridge. Her journey is a harrowing and inspiring memoir about the struggle for self-invention, the pain of leaving a family behind, and the transformative power of education.
themes: education, family, resilience, identity, abuse, triumph
mood_tags: inspiring, intense, emotional, raw, determined, powerful

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
summary: In this intimate and powerful memoir, former First Lady Michelle Obama invites readers into her world, chronicling the experiences that have shaped her—from her childhood on the South Side of Chicago to her time in the White House. She speaks candidly about her struggles, her role as a mother, and her efforts to create a more inclusive America. It is a warm, personal, and authentic story of growth, public service, and finding one's voice.
themes: identity, public service, growth, family, leadership, authenticity
mood_tags: inspiring, warm, personal, authentic, hopeful, engaging

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
summary: Alicia Berenson, a famous painter, shoots her husband five times in the face and then never speaks another word. Theo Faber, a criminal psychotherapist, becomes obsessed with uncovering the motive behind her silence and getting her to talk again. As he digs deeper into her past, he uncovers a shocking truth that twists the narrative in an unforgettable way. This is a tense, mysterious, and psychologically gripping thriller about obsession and the lengths we go to for love.
themes: obsession, truth, silence, psychology, art, shock
mood_tags: tense, mysterious, shocking, suspenseful, dark, addictive

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
summary: Banished to a deserted island by the gods, the witch Circe discovers her power and finds her voice. Over centuries, she encounters famous figures from mythology, including Hermes, Daedalus, and Odysseus. This is a stunning reimagining of the Greek myths from the perspective of a marginalized woman, exploring themes of power, isolation, and the definition of monstrosity. It is lyrical, magical, and deeply empowering.
themes: power, isolation, mythology, feminism, magic, transformation
mood_tags: empowering, lyrical, magical, introspective, mythic, beautiful

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
summary: Told from the perspective of Patroclus, this novel retells the Iliad as a sweeping romance between the exiled prince and the greatest warrior of his age, Achilles. As they grow from boys to men, their bond deepens amidst the backdrop of the Trojan War. It is a tragic, romantic, and emotionally devastating story about love, fate, and the cost of glory, rendered in exquisite, poetic prose.
themes: love, war, fate, destiny, grief, heroism
mood_tags: tragic, romantic, emotional, poetic, heartbreaking, tender

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
summary: Connell and Marianne weave in and out of each other's lives over several years, from high school in a small Irish town to university in Dublin. Misunderstandings, class differences, and personal insecurities keep them apart even as they remain deeply connected. This is a quiet, intimate, and realistic portrayal of young love, communication, and the subtle ways people shape one another.
themes: love, class, communication, intimacy, growth, misunderstanding
mood_tags: melancholic, intimate, realistic, quiet, emotional, raw

title: Lessons in Chemistry
author: Bonnie Garmus
summary: Set in the 1960s, Elizabeth Zott is a brilliant chemist whose career is derailed by sexism. Unexpectedly becoming the host of a TV cooking show, she uses the platform to teach women not just recipes, but science and self-worth, challenging the status quo. With the help of her dog Six-Thirty and her daughter, she empowers a generation of women to demand more. It is witty, defiant, and deeply uplifting.
themes: feminism, science, resilience, empowerment, single-motherhood, justice
mood_tags: uplifting, witty, empowering, humorous, defiant, heartwarming

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
summary: Reclusive Hollywood icon Evelyn Hugo finally decides to tell her life story to an unknown journalist, Monique Grant. As Evelyn recounts her rise to fame, her seven marriages, and her forbidden love, Monique realizes their lives are intertwined in unexpected ways. This is a glamorous, emotional, and secretive tale about ambition, identity, and the price of greatness in the golden age of cinema.
themes: fame, love, identity, ambition, secrets, LGBTQ+
mood_tags: glamorous, emotional, secretive, engaging, dramatic, captivating

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
summary: Lowen Ashleigh, a struggling writer, is hired to finish the remaining books in a successful series by the injured author Verity Crawford. While organizing Verity's office, Lowen discovers a disturbing autobiography that reveals dark secrets about the author's family and marriage. As Lowen falls for Verity's husband, she must decide whether to publish the truth or protect the lie. It is tense, disturbing, and utterly addictive.
themes: obsession, truth, manipulation, marriage, secrets, morality
mood_tags: tense, disturbing, addictive, suspenseful, dark, shocking

title: It Ends with Us
author: Colleen Hoover
summary: Lily Bloom moves to Boston to start a new life and falls for neurosurgeon Ryle Kincaid. However, as their relationship deepens, patterns from her past begin to emerge, forcing her to confront the cycle of abuse she witnessed in her own family. When her first love returns, Lily must make an impossible choice. This is an emotional, heavy, and heartfelt story about breaking cycles and finding the courage to leave.
themes: love, abuse, courage, cycles, trauma, strength
mood_tags: emotional, heavy, heartfelt, heartbreaking, honest, intense

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
summary: Linus Baker, a rigid caseworker for the Department in Charge of Magical Youth, is sent to investigate an orphanage on a remote island. There, he meets six dangerous magical children and their caretaker, Arthur Parnassus. As Linus witnesses the love and acceptance in the house, his worldview shifts, and he discovers the true meaning of family. It is a cozy, heartwarming, and whimsical hug of a book about belonging and kindness.
themes: acceptance, family, magic, love, bureaucracy, chosen-family
mood_tags: cozy, heartwarming, whimsical, sweet, comforting, joyful

title: Anxious People
author: Fredrik Backman
summary: A failed bank robber accidentally takes a group of strangers hostage during an apartment viewing. As the police surround the building, the hostages reveal their own struggles, fears, and secrets, turning a crime thriller into a profound exploration of human connection. With humor and heart, Backman shows how anxiety binds us all and how forgiveness can set us free. It is funny, touching, and deeply hopeful.
themes: humanity, connection, forgiveness, anxiety, community, redemption
mood_tags: funny, touching, hopeful, kind, emotional, wise

title: A Man Called Ove
author: Fredrik Backman
summary: Ove is a grumpy old man who strictly follows rules and plans to end his life after losing his job. However, his plans are repeatedly interrupted by his boisterous new neighbors, who slowly chip away at his hardened exterior. Through flashbacks, we learn of Ove's tragic past and the love that shaped him. This is an uplifting, funny, and touching story about how community can heal even the deepest grief.
themes: community, grief, love, grumpiness, neighborliness, purpose
mood_tags: uplifting, funny, touching, heartwarming, emotional, charming

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
summary: Two young magicians, Celia and Marco, are bound by their mentors to compete in a magical duel within a mysterious circus that opens only at night. As the competition intensifies, they fall deeply in love, unaware that the game can only end when one is left standing. Set in a dreamlike world of black-and-white tents and impossible feats, this is an atmospheric, romantic, and whimsical tale of magic and sacrifice.
themes: magic, love, competition, destiny, dreams, sacrifice
mood_tags: atmospheric, dreamy, romantic, whimsical, mysterious, enchanting

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
summary: After a shipwreck, young Pi Patel finds himself stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker. For 227 days, he must use his ingenuity, faith, and will to survive alongside the predator. This is a thought-provoking, adventurous, and spiritual story about the nature of reality, the power of storytelling, and the instinct to live.
themes: survival, faith, storytelling, religion, nature, resilience
mood_tags: thought-provoking, adventurous, spiritual, imaginative, philosophical

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
summary: Amir, a wealthy boy from Kabul, betrays his loyal friend Hassan, an act that haunts him for decades. Years later, living in America, Amir receives a chance to redeem himself by returning to Taliban-controlled Afghanistan to rescue Hassan's son. This is a heavy, emotional, and powerful story about guilt, redemption, and the enduring bonds of friendship and fatherhood.
themes: redemption, guilt, friendship, betrayal, father-son, war
mood_tags: heavy, emotional, powerful, tragic, honest, moving

title: Never Let Me Go
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
summary: Kathy, Ruth, and Tommy grow up in a seemingly idyllic boarding school in the English countryside. As they mature, they slowly realize the dark purpose of their existence and the grim fate that awaits them. Told with quiet restraint, this is a melancholic, haunting, and dystopian masterpiece about mortality, love, and what it means to be human.
themes: identity, mortality, love, cloning, fate, acceptance
mood_tags: melancholic, quiet, dystopian, haunting, resigned, poignant

title: Station Eleven
author: Emily St. John Mandel
summary: Years after a flu pandemic wipes out most of humanity, a traveling symphony performs music and Shakespeare in the settlements of the Great Lakes region. Interweaving the stories of survivors before and after the collapse, this novel explores the importance of art, memory, and human connection in the face of extinction. It is hopeful, atmospheric, and beautifully written, proving that survival is insufficient.
themes: art, survival, memory, civilization, connection, hope
mood_tags: hopeful, atmospheric, reflective, poetic, resilient, lyrical

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A father and his young son walk alone through a burned, ash-covered America, pushing a cart of scavenged supplies. They face starvation, cannibals, and the cold, holding onto their morality and love for each other in a world devoid of hope. This is a dark, bleak, and intensely moving story about the endurance of love and the struggle to remain 'good guys' in a hopeless world.
themes: survival, love, despair, fatherhood, morality, apocalypse
mood_tags: dark, bleak, intense, grim, loving, harrowing

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
summary: Three women in a picturesque Australian beach town find their lives unraveling to the point of murder following a school trivia night. As the investigation unfolds, secrets about domestic violence, bullying, and infidelity are exposed beneath the surface of their perfect lives. It is a tense, funny, and dramatic page-turner that balances serious themes with sharp wit.
themes: secrets, motherhood, lies, domestic-violence, friendship, scandal
mood_tags: tense, funny, dramatic, satirical, suspenseful, juicy

title: The Guest List
author: Lucy Foley
summary: On a remote island off the coast of Ireland, a glamorous wedding turns into a nightmare when a guest is found murdered. Told from multiple perspectives, including the bride, the groom, and the killer, secrets of revenge, jealousy, and past traumas surface. This is a tense, mysterious, and twisty whodunit that keeps you guessing until the very last page.
themes: revenge, secrets, marriage, jealousy, murder, isolation
mood_tags: tense, mysterious, twisty, suspenseful, cold, addictive

title: Mexican Gothic
author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
summary: Noemí Taboada travels to High Place, a decaying English manor in the Mexican countryside, to check on her cousin who claims her husband is trying to kill her. There, she encounters a sinister family with dark secrets, strange fungi, and a haunting presence. Blending gothic horror with historical fiction, this is an eerie, atmospheric, and unsettling tale of colonialism and madness.
themes: horror, family, decay, colonialism, madness, ghosts
mood_tags: eerie, atmospheric, unsettling, creepy, gothic, suspenseful

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: Victor Frankenstein, a brilliant but obsessed scientist, succeeds in creating life from dead body parts. Horrified by his monstrous creation, he abandons it, leading the creature on a lonely journey of rejection and vengeance. This foundational sci-fi novel is a dark, tragic, and philosophical exploration of ambition, responsibility, and the dangers of playing God.
themes: ambition, nature, monstrosity, isolation, responsibility, revenge
mood_tags: dark, tragic, philosophical, gothic, somber, intellectual

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
summary: Count Dracula moves from Transylvania to England to spread the undead curse, targeting a young lawyer and his fiancée. A small group of heroes, led by Professor Van Helsing, must track the Count across Europe to stop him. Told through letters and diary entries, this classic is tense, scary, and suspenseful, defining the vampire genre forever.
themes: evil, innocence, victory, sexuality, religion, horror
mood_tags: tense, classic, scary, suspenseful, epistolary, gothic

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
summary: Jack Torrance takes a job as the winter caretaker of the isolated Overlook Hotel, bringing his wife and psychic son. As the snow traps them inside, the hotel's evil spirits begin to influence Jack, driving him into madness and violence against his family. This is a terrifying, intense, and psychological horror masterpiece about addiction, isolation, and inherited trauma.
themes: isolation, madness, horror, addiction, family, supernatural
mood_tags: terrifying, intense, psychological, claustrophobic, scary, slow-burn

title: Murder on the Orient Express
author: Agatha Christie
summary: Detective Hercule Poirot is traveling on the famous train when it gets stuck in a snowdrift. When a passenger is found murdered in his locked compartment, Poirot must interview the eclectic mix of passengers to find the killer. This is a clever, satisfying, and classic mystery with one of the most famous twists in literature.
themes: justice, guilt, mystery, revenge, logic, deduction
mood_tags: clever, satisfying, classic, intriguing, logical, cozy

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
summary: Ten strangers are invited to a private island under false pretenses. One by one, they are killed according to a nursery rhyme, and paranoia sets in as they realize the killer is among them. With no escape and no help coming, they must figure out who it is before they are all dead. This is a tense, shocking, and perfectly plotted thriller.
themes: guilt, justice, paranoia, murder, isolation, fear
mood_tags: tense, classic, shocking, suspenseful, eerie, relentless

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
summary: Symbologist Robert Langdon is called to solve a murder in the Louvre, which leads him on a frantic chase across Europe. He uncovers a religious mystery hidden in the works of Leonardo da Vinci and a secret society protecting a shocking truth about Jesus Christ. It is an exciting, puzzle-like, and fast-paced adventure that blends art, history, and conspiracy.
themes: religion, secrets, history, conspiracy, art, puzzles
mood_tags: exciting, puzzle-like, fast, thrilling, controversial, action-packed

title: Angels & Demons
author: Dan Brown
summary: When a physicist is murdered and a canister of antimatter is stolen, Robert Langdon is rushed to the Vatican to stop a secret society from destroying the city. Racing against the clock, he follows a trail of clues through Rome's historic landmarks. This is an urgent, action-packed, and thrilling prequel to The Da Vinci Code, full of science and religious conflict.
themes: science, religion, conspiracy, urgency, history, good-vs-evil
mood_tags: exciting, urgent, action-packed, thrilling, dramatic, fast

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
summary: In the Republic of Gilead, a theocratic dictatorship has replaced the United States. Women are stripped of their rights, and fertile women like Offred are forced into sexual slavery as 'Handmaids.' Through Offred's eyes, we see the horrors of oppression and her quiet resistance. This is a dark, disturbing, and powerful warning about the fragility of women's rights.
themes: oppression, gender, resistance, totalitarianism, fertility, freedom
mood_tags: dark, disturbing, powerful, urgent, dystopian, feminist

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: In a future society engineered for stability and happiness, people are genetically modified and conditioned to consume and obey. When a 'savage' from a reservation is brought to this civilized world, his presence challenges the very foundation of their drug-induced utopia. This is a thought-provoking, cynical, and classic satire on conformity, technology, and the cost of happiness.
themes: conformity, happiness, control, technology, individuality, society
mood_tags: thought-provoking, cynical, classic, satirical, cold, intellectual

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
summary: Guy Montag is a fireman whose job is to burn books in a society where reading is forbidden. After meeting a free-spirited neighbor, he begins to question his role and hides books, becoming a fugitive. This is a thought-provoking, urgent, and poetic classic about censorship, the importance of knowledge, and the danger of passive entertainment.
themes: censorship, knowledge, rebellion, books, conformity, freedom
mood_tags: thought-provoking, urgent, classic, poetic, dystopian, reflective

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Holden Caulfield, a cynical and alienated teenager, wanders around New York City for a few days after being expelled from prep school. He encounters phoniness everywhere and struggles with grief, loneliness, and the fear of growing up. This is a melancholic, relatable, and iconic coming-of-age story told in a unique, confessional voice.
themes: alienation, innocence, growth, grief, phoniness, adolescence
mood_tags: melancholic, cynical, relatable, angsty, confessional, raw

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
summary: A group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island attempt to govern themselves, but their society quickly collapses into savagery. Led by the charismatic but violent Jack, they hunt and kill, losing their innocence and humanity. This is a dark, intense, and symbolic allegory about the inherent evil in mankind and the thin veneer of civilization.
themes: civilization, evil, survival, power, innocence, mob-mentality
mood_tags: dark, intense, symbolic, grim, allegorical, disturbing

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
summary: Farm animals overthrow their human owner to create a society of equality, but the pigs soon seize power and become tyrants themselves. Led by Napoleon, the farm descends into a dictatorship where 'all animals are equal, but some are more equal than others.' This is a satirical, dark, and simple allegory for the Russian Revolution and the corruption of power.
themes: power, corruption, politics, revolution, equality, tyranny
mood_tags: satirical, dark, simple, cynical, allegorical, sharp

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
summary: Orphaned Jane Eyre grows up to become a governess at Thornfield Hall, where she falls in love with her brooding employer, Mr. Rochester. But a dark secret hidden in the attic threatens their happiness. Jane must choose between her passion and her moral principles in this gothic, romantic, and empowering story of a woman demanding independence.
themes: love, independence, morality, class, secrets, feminism
mood_tags: romantic, gothic, strong, passionate, moral, intense

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
summary: The intense and destructive love between Heathcliff, an orphan, and Catherine Earnshaw spans two generations on the Yorkshire moors. Fueled by revenge and passion, their love destroys everyone around them. This is a wild, tragic, and atmospheric gothic romance that explores the darkest corners of the human heart.
themes: love, revenge, nature, passion, obsession, destruction
mood_tags: intense, tragic, wild, passionate, dark, stormy

title: Emma
author: Jane Austen
summary: Emma Woodhouse, a handsome and wealthy young woman, delights in meddling in the love lives of her friends and neighbors. However, her matchmaking schemes often go awry, leading to misunderstandings and heartbreak. Through her mistakes, Emma learns humility and eventually finds love herself. It is a witty, lighthearted, and charming comedy of manners.
themes: matchmaking, growth, class, love, self-deception, community
mood_tags: witty, lighthearted, romantic, humorous, charming, clever

title: Sense and Sensibility
author: Jane Austen
summary: The Dashwood sisters, Elinor (sense) and Marianne (sensibility), navigate love and heartbreak after their father's death leaves them poor. Elinor hides her feelings to protect others, while Marianne indulges in dramatic emotion. Both must find a balance between head and heart to find happiness. It is a gentle, sensible, and romantic classic.
themes: love, reason, emotion, family, heartbreak, balance
mood_tags: romantic, balanced, classic, gentle, emotional, wise

title: Mansfield Park
author: Jane Austen
summary: Fanny Price, a poor niece, is raised by her wealthy aunt and uncle at Mansfield Park. Often overlooked and treated poorly, she remains the moral center of the family as her cousins indulge in reckless behavior and a theatrical production. Fanny must stand firm in her principles against pressure and temptation. It is a serious, reflective, and principled romance.
themes: morality, status, love, integrity, family, silence
mood_tags: serious, reflective, romantic, quiet, principled, steady

title: Northanger Abbey
author: Jane Austen
summary: Catherine Morland, a naive girl obsessed with gothic novels, visits Bath and later Northanger Abbey. Her vivid imagination leads her to suspect dark secrets and murders that don't exist, causing embarrassment and confusion. Eventually, she learns to distinguish fiction from reality and finds true love. It is a witty, fun, and satirical parody of gothic tropes.
themes: imagination, love, satire, naivety, reality, growth
mood_tags: witty, fun, romantic, playful, satirical, lighthearted

title: Persuasion
author: Jane Austen
summary: Anne Elliot was persuaded to reject Captain Wentworth years ago due to his lack of wealth. Now, he returns rich and successful, and Anne must navigate her lingering feelings and family interference to seize a second chance at love. It is a mature, melancholic, and deeply romantic story about regret, constancy, and the endurance of love.
themes: love, regret, second-chances, constancy, class, navy
mood_tags: melancholic, mature, romantic, reflective, hopeful, tender

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
summary: Edmond Dantès is falsely imprisoned for treason on his wedding day. After escaping and discovering a hidden treasure, he reinvents himself as the Count of Monte Cristo and spends years meticulously orchestrating revenge on those who betrayed him. This is an epic, satisfying, and dramatic tale of justice, patience, and the corrupting nature of vengeance.
themes: revenge, justice, patience, betrayal, wealth, transformation
mood_tags: epic, satisfying, long, dramatic, vengeful, adventurous

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
summary: Jean Valjean, an ex-convict, seeks redemption while being relentlessly pursued by the obsessive Inspector Javert. Set against the backdrop of post-Napoleonic France and the June Rebellion, the story weaves together the lives of the poor, the lovers, and the revolutionaries. It is an epic, emotional, and heavy masterpiece about grace, justice, and the human capacity for love.
themes: redemption, justice, love, revolution, poverty, grace
mood_tags: epic, emotional, heavy, grand, compassionate, sweeping
